results.title: Man of wheat: the saga of Glen Miller
results.brief_description: A study of Glen Miller, an ex-school teacher who went into farming in America in 1942, and who has since built up a huge acreage, coupled with a high level of capital invesment. His sons and grandsons help run the farm as well as maintain the huge and expensive machinery that lies idle all year round, except for the five weeks of harvesting when it is put to work seven days a week, eighteen hours a day. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Human journey: the early years
results.creator_credit: Jerry Lawton, CTV News and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Discusses the emotional needs of infants from birth to approximately five years. Emphasises the importance of the mother’s role. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Islands within islands within islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Firstbrook, Rodger Jones, Andrew Crilly, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Studies the Hawaiian islands and the varied environments to be found there - eg deserts and frozen ash. Describes the formation of the islands and the ways in which plants may have migrated to newly formed volcanic islands. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Pollution of upper and lower atmosphere
results.brief_description: Analyses the effects on the lower atmosphere of the internal combustion engine of the internal combustion engine and other fixtures and the effects on the upper atmosphere of high flying jet aircraft.

results.title: Land use and misuse
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Describes malpractice in the use of land surfaces. Shows how deforestation, erosion by wind and water, industrial and agricultural abuses and urban development can create loss of water, crops and wildlife and can even cause climatic changes. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Autobiography of a princess
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: An Indian rajah’s past is recalled by his exiled daughter (Madhur Jaffrey) and his ageing tutor (James Mason), interspersed with old movies from the rajah’s archives. An absorbing character study which also reveals something of the complexities and contradictions of India and the role of the British in India. Written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Truman and the Korean war
results.brief_description: Presents a journalist’s perspective of the Korean War supplemented by excellent footage, and outlines the role played by Truman and MacArthur, noting the events that led to MacArthur’s being relieved of his command. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Truman and the Cold War
results.brief_description: Provides a background to the development of the Cold War. Includes graphic footage of the plight of refugees in post-war Europe; notes the Truman doctrine of giving aid to free nations threatened by aggression, by providing a case study of Greece where partisans supported by communists strove to get rid of the monarchy; the Marshall Aid Program; the Berlin Blockade and the consequent formation of NATO. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Rock U.S.A. Part 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part series. Presents an overview of rock music throughout America featuring a strange mixture of artists including early footage of Blondie (Debra Harry) and raw and energetic performances by the Dead Boys, Heart, Mother’s Finest and Southside Johnny and the Asbury Jukes.
